key_points: New research by Avaaz shows Facebook's algorithm can lead users towards vaccine misinformation.
The investigation involved creating new user accounts and monitoring the recommended content related to vaccines.
109 of 180 pages recommended to researchers spread anti-vaccine content.
Facebook's algorithm also recommended pages about autism linked to vaccines, a debunked myth.
The study suggests Facebook's design choices push users deeper into misinformation networks.
Facebook announced stopping recommendations of health-related groups but not pages with health misinformation.
Nate Miller from Avaaz highlighted inconsistencies in Facebook's misinformation policies.
Secrecy around platforms' algorithmic architecture challenges misinformation combat efforts.
European Commission's guidance aims at legally binding measures for platforms to fight disinformation under the upcoming Digital Services Act.
Avaaz emphasizes the need for transparency and changes in algorithms to counter misinformation.
